Sentencas: A physically-based model for design and optimization of a fuel cell powered electric propulsion system for an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) is presented.
Titulo: Simulation, Design, and Validation of an UAV SOFC Propulsion System

Sentencas: Components of the system include a solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) providing power, motor controller, brushless dc (BLDC) motor, and a propeller.
Titulo: Simulation, Design, and Validation of an UAV SOFC Propulsion System

Sentencas: Steady-state models for these components are integrated into a simulation program and solved numerically.
Titulo: Simulation, Design, and Validation of an UAV SOFC Propulsion System

Sentencas: This allows an operator to select constraints and explore design trade-offs between components, including fuel cell, controller, motor, and propeller options.
Titulo: Simulation, Design, and Validation of an UAV SOFC Propulsion System

Sentencas: We also present a graphical procedure using this model that allows rapid assessment and selection of design choices, including fuel cell characteristics and hybridization with multiple sources.
Titulo: Simulation, Design, and Validation of an UAV SOFC Propulsion System

Sentencas: A series of experiments conducted on an instrumented propulsion system in a low-speed wind tunnel were performed for comparison of individual component and full propulsion system performance with simulation model predictions.
Titulo: Simulation, Design, and Validation of an UAV SOFC Propulsion System

Sentencas: Data from these experiments are provided and are consistent with model predictions.
Titulo: Simulation, Design, and Validation of an UAV SOFC Propulsion System
